intro: Athanasia oligocephala var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-headed alyssum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves and stems, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
